paragraphs.body: The badgermole is an enormous, blind ${link_0} native to the ${link_1}. Primarily subterranean creatures, badgermoles were the first to master ${link_2} and were the original instructors from which humans first learned the art. Notably, ${link_3} developed her skill in earthbending through observing the ways in which badgermoles used earthbending as an extension of their senses while navigating underground cave systems.
paragraphs.text: The badgermole is an enormous, blind mammal native to the Earth Kingdom. Primarily subterranean creatures, badgermoles were the first to master earthbending and were the original instructors from which humans first learned the art. Notably, Toph Beifong developed her skill in earthbending through observing the ways in which badgermoles used earthbending as an extension of their senses while navigating underground cave systems.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} and ${link_1} were the first humans to be taught earthbending by the badgermoles. The two lovers and the badgermoles created a ${link_2} through the mountains dividing their two villages, allowing them to meet in secret. The tunnels' ceilings were embedded with crystals that would only glow in total darkness and led to the tunnels' exit.
paragraphs.text: Oma and Shu were the first humans to be taught earthbending by the badgermoles. The two lovers and the badgermoles created a maze of tunnels through the mountains dividing their two villages, allowing them to meet in secret. The tunnels' ceilings were embedded with crystals that would only glow in total darkness and led to the tunnels' exit.

paragraphs.body: Toph also learned the ${link_0} from badgermoles. Once, after running away from home as a child, she encountered the badgermoles in a cave. According to her, their earthbending was not merely centered around fighting, but an extension of their senses and their way of interacting with the ${link_1}. She learned earthbending through copying the badgermoles' movements while navigating the tunnels.
paragraphs.text: Toph also learned the bending art from badgermoles. Once, after running away from home as a child, she encountered the badgermoles in a cave. According to her, their earthbending was not merely centered around fighting, but an extension of their senses and their way of interacting with the world. She learned earthbending through copying the badgermoles' movements while navigating the tunnels.

paragraphs.body: Several years later, ${link_0} met a group of nomads who brought them to the Cave of Two Lovers, a passage under the ${link_1}. Eventually, Team Avatar and their companions got lost in these caverns as the badgermoles were using earthbending to alter the layout of the underground network. After being separated from the rest of the group, ${link_2}, ${link_3}, ${link_4}, and the other nomads encountered these creatures, who initially demonstrated aggressive bending. However, they serenaded the badgermoles with music, pacifying them, and were able to ride them out the other side of the cave.
paragraphs.text: Several years later, Team Avatar met a group of nomads who brought them to the Cave of Two Lovers, a passage under the Kolau Mountains. Eventually, Team Avatar and their companions got lost in these caverns as the badgermoles were using earthbending to alter the layout of the underground network. After being separated from the rest of the group, Sokka, Chong, Moku, and the other nomads encountered these creatures, who initially demonstrated aggressive bending. However, they serenaded the badgermoles with music, pacifying them, and were able to ride them out the other side of the cave.

paragraphs.body: Decades later, Prince ${link_0} established a connection with two badgermoles at the ${link_1} zoo by singing to them. In 174 ${link_2}, when ${link_3} ${link_4} the city, the prince freed those badgermoles and guided them with his singing toward ${link_5}. Ordered by song, they started to tunnel underneath the city and took down three ${link_6} of the ${link_7} when they threatened Prince Wu and several evacuees.
paragraphs.text: Decades later, Prince Wu established a connection with two badgermoles at the Republic City zoo by singing to them. In 174 AG, when Kuvira invaded the city, the prince freed those badgermoles and guided them with his singing toward Central City Station. Ordered by song, they started to tunnel underneath the city and took down three mecha suits of the military of the Earth Empire when they threatened Prince Wu and several evacuees.

paragraphs.body: Badgermoles are enormous in size and have brown fur with one white stripe between two black ones running down their backs and white, mask-like patches on their faces. They have long tails and five claws on each paw. Badgermoles use their noses and sensitive whiskers to inspect objects in front of them. Although they have vestigial eyes, evolutionary leftovers from long-forgotten times when they lived above ground, badgermoles are more-or-less blind; their earthbending abilities allow them to feel the presence of their surroundings in recompense.
paragraphs.text: Badgermoles are enormous in size and have brown fur with one white stripe between two black ones running down their backs and white, mask-like patches on their faces. They have long tails and five claws on each paw. Badgermoles use their noses and sensitive whiskers to inspect objects in front of them. Although they have vestigial eyes, evolutionary leftovers from long-forgotten times when they lived above ground, badgermoles are more-or-less blind; their earthbending abilities allow them to feel the presence of their surroundings in recompense.

paragraphs.body: Badgermoles use their tongues to lick in order to show their affection, an action seen when Toph first met them. They enjoy hearing music, which seems to put them in an almost tranquil state in which one can get them to do nearly anything. Badgermoles use earthbending to form tunnels and travel underground, where they live and hunt for prey; the creatures seem to be the natural predator of the ${link_0}.
paragraphs.text: Badgermoles use their tongues to lick in order to show their affection, an action seen when Toph first met them. They enjoy hearing music, which seems to put them in an almost tranquil state in which one can get them to do nearly anything. Badgermoles use earthbending to form tunnels and travel underground, where they live and hunt for prey; the creatures seem to be the natural predator of the wolfbats.

paragraphs.body: When fully and properly tamed, badgermoles can be used as beasts of burden and can perform tasks such as paving pathways or clearing stone debris, such as during the ${link_0}.
paragraphs.text: When fully and properly tamed, badgermoles can be used as beasts of burden and can perform tasks such as paving pathways or clearing stone debris, such as during the Earth Rumble tournament.

paragraphs.body: The badgermole resembles a cross between the American badger and the common mole. The facial coloring and white back stripe of the badgermole resemble the badger whereas its claws, tail, and eyes are indicative of the mole's. Both animals are among the best diggers in the animal kingdom: badgers are powerful diggers that can dig through the toughest earth, and moles, also quick diggers, almost "swim" through the earth.
paragraphs.text: The badgermole resembles a cross between the American badger and the common mole. The facial coloring and white back stripe of the badgermole resemble the badger whereas its claws, tail, and eyes are indicative of the mole's. Both animals are among the best diggers in the animal kingdom: badgers are powerful diggers that can dig through the toughest earth, and moles, also quick diggers, almost "swim" through the earth.

paragraphs.body: Badgermoles are blind like Toph, so they were able to understand each other well, and therefore taught Toph how to earthbend.
paragraphs.text: Badgermoles are blind like Toph, so they were able to understand each other well, and therefore taught Toph how to earthbend.

paragraphs.body: In Earth Rumble VI, an underground earthbending tournament held in a giant earthen arena in ${link_0}, badgermoles were used to clear the ring of rocks.
paragraphs.text: In Earth Rumble VI, an underground earthbending tournament held in a giant earthen arena in Gaoling, badgermoles were used to clear the ring of rocks.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} had a ${link_1} of a purple badgermole on his back.
paragraphs.text: The Boulder had a tattoo of a purple badgermole on his back.

paragraphs.body:
Badgermoles are the only original animal benders that are not known to be a companion to an ${link_0}. ${link_1} had ${link_2}, a ${link_3}, as a lifelong friend, and ${link_4} had ${link_5}, a ${link_6}.
 They are also the only original animal benders that are not known to have been killed substantially by the ${link_7}; the dragons were killed for glory and pride, with only ${link_8} known survivors, and many sky bison were killed along with the ${link_9} during the ${link_10}.
paragraphs.text:
Badgermoles are the only original animal benders that are not known to be a companion to an Avatar. Roku had Fang, a dragon, as a lifelong friend, and Aang had Appa, a flying bison.
 They are also the only original animal benders that are not known to have been killed substantially by the Fire Nation; the dragons were killed for glory and pride, with only two known survivors, and many sky bison were killed along with the Air Nomads during the Air Nomad Genocide.

paragraphs.body: After the ${link_0}, a ${link_1} named itself the ${link_2} Badgermoles.
paragraphs.text: After the Hundred Year War, a pro-bending team named itself the Ba Sing Se Badgermoles.

paragraphs.body: According to Chong, badgermoles hate wolfbats.
paragraphs.text: According to Chong, badgermoles hate wolfbats.

paragraphs.body:
Due to the badgermole's importance in Earth Kingdom history, the animal has had an influence on the art of the nation.
 The ${link_0}'s throne in the ${link_1} is designed after a badgermole.
 Two bagdermole statues are found outside the Earth King's palace. These stone sculptures were launched at Team Avatar by the ${link_2} when the Avatar and his friends attempted to break into the Royal Palace.
 Ornate badgermole statues are also found in the ruins of ${link_3}.

Due to the badgermole's importance in Earth Kingdom history, the animal has had an influence on the art of the nation.
 The earth monarch's throne in the Earth Kingdom Royal Palace is designed after a badgermole.
 Two bagdermole statues are found outside the Earth King's palace. These stone sculptures were launched at Team Avatar by the Royal Earthbender Guards when the Avatar and his friends attempted to break into the Royal Palace.
 Ornate badgermole statues are also found in the ruins of Taku.
